requirement_tested: Display a dashboard layout with teal-styled components and mint cream background
user_persona: A financial analyst who needs to quickly assess the overall health of multiple companies.
user_goal: To view a visually appealing and consistent dashboard layout that helps organize financial data.

narrative_steps.title: Loading the Dashboard
narrative_steps.description: Sarah opens the financial dashboard in her browser. She immediately notices the clean, mint cream background and teal-styled components.
narrative_steps.action: Open the financial dashboard URL in the browser.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The dashboard loads with a mint cream background and all UI elements styled in teal colors.

narrative_steps.title: Navigating Components
narrative_steps.description: Sarah scrolls through the dashboard and sees a responsive grid layout with teal-styled cards and headers.
narrative_steps.action: Scroll down to observe the layout structure and component styling.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: All components including headers, cards, and navigation bars are consistently styled with teal accents against a mint cream background.

requirement_tested: Allow users to browse financial data from each company in a structured manner
user_persona: A portfolio manager reviewing quarterly earnings across several firms.
user_goal: To efficiently browse financial data from each company in a clear and organized way.

narrative_steps.title: Selecting a Company
narrative_steps.description: Mike clicks on the first company listed in the sidebar to view its financial data.
narrative_steps.action: Click on a company name in the sidebar menu.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The main content area updates to show financial metrics for the selected company in a structured card layout.

narrative_steps.title: Viewing Detailed Metrics
narrative_steps.description: Mike expands the company card to see more detailed financial information.
narrative_steps.action: Click on a company card to expand and show detailed financial metrics.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Additional financial details such as revenue breakdowns and expense categories are displayed within the expanded card.

requirement_tested: Provide consolidated financial reports across multiple companies
user_persona: A CFO preparing an executive summary for stakeholders.
user_goal: To generate and review a consolidated financial report summarizing all companies' performance.

narrative_steps.title: Generating Consolidated Report
narrative_steps.description: Lisa navigates to the consolidated reports section and clicks the 'Generate Report' button.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Generate Report' button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The system fetches and displays a consolidated financial summary across all companies including total revenue, combined profit, and overall asset valuation.

narrative_steps.title: Customizing Report Filters
narrative_steps.description: Lisa applies date range filters to focus on Q3 results.
narrative_steps.action: Click on filter options and select a date range.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The consolidated report updates to reflect only data within the selected date range.

requirement_tested: Enable cross-company financial comparisons and reporting capabilities
user_persona: An investment analyst comparing the performance of competing firms.
user_goal: To visually compare financial metrics between selected companies.

narrative_steps.title: Opening Comparison Tool
narrative_steps.description: Tom clicks the 'Compare Companies' button to open the multi-select modal.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Compare Companies' button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A modal dialog appears with checkboxes to select multiple companies for comparison.

narrative_steps.title: Viewing Comparative Charts
narrative_steps.description: Tom selects three companies and views their performance side-by-side using bar charts.
narrative_steps.action: Select companies and click on chart tabs to switch between visualization types.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Interactive bar charts display comparative financial metrics such as revenue and profit for the selected companies.

requirement_tested: Implement a frontend that fetches all financial data from backend APIs
user_persona: A developer testing data integrity in the dashboard application.
user_goal: To verify that the frontend retrieves live financial data from backend services.

narrative_steps.title: Initial Page Load
narrative_steps.description: Alex loads the dashboard and checks if initial data is fetched from the backend.
narrative_steps.action: Load the dashboard page.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Company list and latest financial data are retrieved dynamically from backend APIs without using mock data.

narrative_steps.title: Refreshing Data
narrative_steps.description: Alex clicks the refresh button to simulate a manual data update.
narrative_steps.action: Click the refresh button to re-fetch updated financial data.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The dashboard reloads with fresh financial data pulled directly from backend endpoints.

requirement_tested: Include a backend service that connects to an external PostgreSQL database
user_persona: A DevOps engineer ensuring proper backend infrastructure.
user_goal: To confirm that the backend successfully connects to the specified PostgreSQL database.

narrative_steps.title: Starting Backend Service
narrative_steps.description: The backend server starts up and attempts to connect to the PostgreSQL database.
narrative_steps.action: Start the backend server.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The backend initializes and establishes a connection to the PostgreSQL database using configured environment variables.

requirement_tested: Configure the backend to use specific environment variables for database connection
user_persona: A system administrator setting up the application environment.
user_goal: To validate that the backend uses correct environment variables for database access.

narrative_steps.title: Checking Environment Variables
narrative_steps.description: The system checks that environment variables are properly loaded at startup.
narrative_steps.action: Observe the backend logs during startup.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Logs confirm successful reading and application of environment variables DB_HOST, DB_PORT, DB_USERNAME, DB_PASSWORD, and DB_NAME.

requirement_tested: Support dynamic retrieval of financial data without hard-coded or mock data
user_persona: A QA tester verifying data authenticity.
user_goal: To ensure all displayed financial data comes from the actual database.

narrative_steps.title: Verifying Live Data Fetching
narrative_steps.description: Emma checks that the dashboard does not show static or mocked values.
narrative_steps.action: Inspect the network tab in browser developer tools to monitor API calls.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: All financial data is fetched via RESTful API calls to the backend, confirming no hardcoded or mock data is used.

requirement_tested: Ensure all components are styled consistently with teal color scheme
user_persona: A UX designer reviewing visual consistency.
user_goal: To confirm that every UI element adheres to the teal color palette.

narrative_steps.title: Reviewing Component Styling
narrative_steps.description: The designer inspects various UI elements to ensure uniform teal styling.
narrative_steps.action: Examine buttons, headers, cards, and other components for consistent color application.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: All UI components utilize varying shades of teal for branding and visual hierarchy, maintaining a cohesive look.

requirement_tested: Create a responsive dashboard layout suitable for financial data visualization
user_persona: A business user accessing the dashboard on a tablet device.
user_goal: To have a usable and readable dashboard layout on mobile and desktop devices.

narrative_steps.title: Resizing Browser Window
narrative_steps.description: The user resizes the browser window to simulate a mobile view.
narrative_steps.action: Resize the browser window to smaller dimensions.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The layout adjusts dynamically, components reorganize, and charts resize appropriately to fit the available space.

requirement_tested: Provide functionality to view detailed financial information per company
user_persona: A financial auditor needing full transparency into company finances.
user_goal: To access comprehensive financial statements for individual companies.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing Company Detail View
narrative_steps.description: The auditor clicks on a company card to view its detailed financial overview.
narrative_steps.action: Click on a company card or detail link to navigate to a detailed financial page.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A new page opens displaying full financial statements including income statements, balance sheets, and cash flow reports.

requirement_tested: Enable users to generate and view consolidated financial summaries
user_persona: A senior executive requiring quick insights into company performance.
user_goal: To generate a consolidated financial summary to guide strategic decisions.

narrative_steps.title: Generating Summary Overview
narrative_steps.description: The executive clicks the 'Generate Summary' button to update the consolidated view.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Generate Summary' button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The consolidated financial overview updates with the latest aggregated data including totals, percentages, and key highlights.

requirement_tested: Support filtering and sorting of financial data by company or time period
user_persona: A data analyst focusing on specific sectors or periods.
user_goal: To filter and sort financial data according to custom criteria.

narrative_steps.title: Applying Filters
narrative_steps.description: The analyst selects specific companies and date ranges from the filter panel.
narrative_steps.action: Select filters from dropdown menus to apply to financial data listings.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Financial data listing updates to show only entries matching the selected criteria.

narrative_steps.title: Sorting Data
narrative_steps.description: The analyst sorts the filtered data by profit margin descending.
narrative_steps.action: Click on sorting indicators to reorder data by various criteria.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The financial data list is reordered based on the selected sorting option.

requirement_tested: Implement user authentication and authorization for accessing financial data
user_persona: A junior employee trying to access restricted financial data.
user_goal: To securely log into the dashboard and gain appropriate access rights.

narrative_steps.title: Logging In
narrative_steps.description: The user enters their credentials on the login form.
narrative_steps.action: Submit the login form with valid username and password.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The system authenticates the user and redirects them to the dashboard with appropriate access levels.

narrative_steps.title: Logging Out
narrative_steps.description: After completing tasks, the user logs out to end their session.
narrative_steps.action: Click the logout button in the top-right corner.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The user's session is terminated and they are redirected to the login page.

requirement_tested: Configure package.json with npm run install:all and npm run dev scripts for concurrent frontend and backend startup
user_persona: A developer setting up the project locally.
user_goal: To easily install dependencies and start both frontend and backend servers.

narrative_steps.title: Installing Dependencies
narrative_steps.description: The developer runs the install command to set up all necessary packages.
narrative_steps.action: Run the command 'npm run install:all'.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Both frontend and backend dependencies are installed successfully.

narrative_steps.title: Starting Development Servers
narrative_steps.description: The developer starts both frontend and backend servers together.
narrative_steps.action: Run the command 'npm run dev'.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The frontend and backend servers start concurrently and become accessible at their respective ports.
